channel.title: Consulate Diff Watch - Monthly Changelog
channel.description: Monthly curated changelog of official consulate and visa program page updates for immigration agencies and consultants

item.title: US Embassy Berlin - B1/B2 Visa Processing Times Updated
item.description:
Important Update: Processing time estimate for B1/B2 tourist and business visas increased from 3 weeks to 6 weeks. Emergency appointment availability unchanged.

Before (Nov 30, 2025): Current processing time for B1/B2 visa appointments: approximately 3 weeks from interview date to passport return with visa.

After (Dec 12, 2025): Current processing time for B1/B2 visa appointments: approximately 6 weeks from interview date to passport return with visa. Expedited processing available for emergency cases only.

Source: travel.state.gov/berlin
item.dc:creator: Consulate Diff Watch Editorial Team

item.title: Canadian Consulate NYC - Working Holiday Eligibility Expanded
item.description:
Moderate Update: Working Holiday visa age limit increased from 30 to 35 years for US citizens. Application quota for 2026 also increased.

Before (Dec 1, 2025): Eligibility: US citizens aged 18-30 may apply for the International Experience Canada (IEC) Working Holiday visa. Annual quota: 5,000 places.

After (Dec 8, 2025): Eligibility: US citizens aged 18-35 may apply for the International Experience Canada (IEC) Working Holiday visa. Annual quota for 2026: 7,500 places. Age change effective January 1, 2026.

Source: canada.ca/working-holiday
item.dc:creator: Consulate Diff Watch Editorial Team

item.title: UK Visa Application Centre - Document Requirements Changed
item.description:
Minor Update: New requirement for digital photo upload added to Skilled Worker visa applications. Physical photos no longer accepted.

Before (Nov 28, 2025): Photo requirements: Provide 2 printed passport-style photographs meeting UK visa photo standards at your appointment.

After (Dec 5, 2025): Photo requirements: Upload a digital passport-style photograph meeting UK visa photo standards when completing your online application. Physical photos will no longer be accepted at appointments.

Source: gov.uk/skilled-worker-visa
item.dc:creator: Consulate Diff Watch Editorial Team

item.title: November 2025 Monthly Digest Available
item.description:
The November 2025 monthly changelog is now available with 8 tracked updates across US, Canadian, UK, and Schengen consulates.

Highlights include: New biometric requirements for Schengen visas, changes to US visa interview waiver programs, and updates to Canadian Express Entry point calculations.
item.dc:creator: Consulate Diff Watch Editorial Team
